timeline.message:
Moved Controller, ControllerImpl and a few related classes to io.pravega.client.control.impl.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

KeyValueTable contracts for Controller operations

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

Removed extra method.

Signed-off-by: Andrei Paduroiu <andrei.paduroiu@emc.com>

timeline.bodyText: This was something we very deliberately avoided in the way we layed out the directory structure. This object is returned to users, so even though it is inside of the impl directory there is a temptation to call methods on it. Let's try to work out a way to avoid making this publicly callable. Perhaps by having the map passed to the caller rather than the position object?
timeline.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText:
Looks like this is only invoked from ModelHelper.getSegmentsFromPositions which is actually not used anywhere. Same with the one below (invoked in ModelHelper.toSegmentOffsetMap which is not used anywhere.
I deleted those methods in ModelHelper and reverted the changes in PositionInternal.java.
replies.author: andreipaduroiu

timeline.author: tkaitchuck
